bibl.title: The Trojan War's Reception in Early Greek Lyric, Iambic and Elegiac Poetry.
bibl.note: Paper presented at the conference Intentionale Geschichte - Spinning Time at the Albert-Ludwigs-Universität Freiburg on September, 14-16, 2006. - 1. Early sympotic elegy. - 2. Sympotic iambus. - 3. Sympotic lyric. - 4. Poetry composed for public performance: Lyric. - 5. Poetry composed for public performance: Elegiac. - 6. Conclusions. - Includes several fragments preserved on papyrus (text and translation).

bibl.title: Intentional History. Spinning Time in Ancient Greece

bibl.seg: BOWIE Ewen, The Trojan War's Reception in Early Greek Lyric, Iambic and Elegiac Poetry.
Lin FOXHALL, Hans-Joachim GEHRKE and Nino LURAGHI (Edd.), Intentional History. Spinning Time in Ancient Greece = Alte Geschichte (Stuttgart, 2010) pp. 57-87.

Paper presented at the conference Intentionale Geschichte - Spinning Time at the Albert-Ludwigs-Universität Freiburg on September, 14-16, 2006. - 1. Early sympotic elegy. - 2. Sympotic iambus. - 3. Sympotic lyric. - 4. Poetry composed for public performance: Lyric. - 5. Poetry composed for public performance: Elegiac. - 6. Conclusions. - Includes several fragments preserved on papyrus (text and translation).
